Correction: The MXX models are not M Sports (which is a package on lower trims), they are M Performance models. They sit above M Sport and under M because the M team actually breathed on them (just to a lesser degree than the pure breds).

Great video and review as always guys! Love your critiques but miss your Box test!!
I have a 2021 x3 M40i and the power is addictive but very accessible. The X3M on my test drive was not compatible with commuting due to a super harsh suspension. Audi, MB, and Volvo canâ€™t come close to this combo of power, fuel economy, cargo space and passenger spaceâ€¦plus the infotainment is really great. Exhaust note is also maturing nicely over time. Interesting to note that the highway mph actually went down with the mild hybrid system and the US EPA found no benefit with city mpg. In Ecopro mode this will reliably get 25-27 mpg on the highway at high speed (~75-80mph). I love this car!

We absolutely adore our 2020 X3 M40i.  It has the same engine tune but no mild-hybrid system.  That thing has been such a tank; it has taken a hit from a truck and continued to run perfectly.  It can deal with deep snow with no problems either, even with the A/S tires (star spec Bridgestones).  It has been super ergonomic, super efficient, and fun for my wife and I.  I would recommend one for anyone even if they have to pay a little more than they want, you wonâ€™t regret it!

I have a 2021 X3 M40i and I absolutely love it. I drove the X3M and the ride was just too harsh for a daily driver. My car is pretty loaded up with the same rims and I still feel like it's a great value. BTW, I have the exposed wood trim, no cowboy branding tho .

I have a theory about M; I think BMW is acutely aware of how "diluted" M cars have become in the balance between enthusiast driving and daily commuting. Starting with the current M3/4, it looks like they are making M even more hardcore and using the M-sport to satisfy all the people who want a more daily-livable M-car. Ergo the Mx40i cars getting all the badges, the mirrors, and even the special edition M-things like the retro emblem. Also why they are getting way more performant than they have ever been before.

I drove 3 x3/X4Mâ€™s to convince myself, coming from an F82. Ended up with an x4 M40i. I strongly advise potential buyers to try these Pseudo Mâ€™s without hate. Ultimately, the M40i drove very well, was better damped and sounded better. The x3/X4M just are not as intense as youâ€™d hope, and when you consider gas/maint/insurance itâ€™s not just a few hundred difference. Donâ€™t forget the engine is tuned more NA on Mâ€™s which is frustrating in daily driving. I used to hate these M performance cars after 5 Mâ€™s but I put my ego aside and ended up enjoying these. Worth a shot.

I have a 991.2 gt3 . The performance of our X3 is just about enough to make me sell the gt3 . But â€¦ expect to buy a new set of tires every three or four oil changes and these tires arenâ€™t cheap . The x3 has a rear tire power bias which results in uneven wear  of the rears over the fronts . The accepted tolerance is 2/32nds difference otherwise too much wear  or abuse of differential . Would have kept me from buying one . Also , you canâ€™t just replace the rears because then theyâ€™ll have too much tread compared to the fronts . Eventually they even out but this is beyond bmw spec and will probably void your warranty . I have 40k on mine , have a dedicated set of winters on wheels so that 40k doesnâ€™t even represent the wear on my summers .
